list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Update library version and refine utility functions
Updated the version of the Vaul Python library from 0.2.0 to 0.2.1. The update also includes refinement to the utility functions, with removal of the check for empty input dictionaries and the simplification of the key removal logic in 'utils.py'. Additionally, made changes in 'decorators.py' to allow empty arguments in the required field.

task.summary:
Added .gitignore, setup files, and LICENSE file
This commit adds a .gitignore file to the repository, ensures that build files and cache files will be ignored by the git repository. Added Python package setup files (setup.py, setup.cfg) to the project. Also, added GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE (LICENSE.txt) to the project.

Update version in setup.py
This commit updates the version of the "vaul" package from "0.1.2" to "0.1.21" in the setup.py file to reflect the latest changes. No other modifications were made to the codebase.

Update Vaul framework and exception handling
This commit updates the Vaul package from "0.1.21" to "0.1.23" and introduces changes in Vaul's core handling of actions and error responses. A new feature to preserve output types within actions was added and default error responses have been replaced with a new custom exception class hierarchy. Additionally, some minor updates to the API's descriptions were done.

Add CurlCommandParser and update Vaul initialization
Added a new feature to parse CURL commands and modified the initialization parameters of the Vaul class. The added `CurlCommandParser` class can parse curl commands into a structured format. The Vaul initialization now includes a `name` parameter to facilitate more precise Vaul instance identification. Changes also include minor updates to the OpenAPI schema generation.

Update version and enhance logging in Vaul
Updated the version number in setup.py and improved the logging functionality in vaul. The logging now includes a log level validation, and exceptions are no longer printed but logged with an error severity level. A additional change includes the setting of the logger's level based on the new log_level attribute of the Vaul class.

Update package version in setup.py
The package version for Vaul in setup.py has been updated. This change reflects the new version "0.1.25" which includes recent modifications and improvements to the package.

Add logging and update log level validation
Imported logging module and updated Vaul's validate_log_level method to use getLevelName. The code is now more aligned with Python's recommended logging usage, providing a standardized way to handle logging levels.

Update Vaul class constructor and bump up package version
The Vaul class constructor in __init__.py has been updated to include title and description parameters. Updated the package version in setup.py from 0.1.25 to 0.1.27. The modified constructor enhances the initialization process by ensuring the presence of necessary attributes.

Removed vaul framework features, introduced tool call functionality and utilities
This commit removes the previous AWS serverless API functionality of Vaul and introduces simplified tool call definition for AI systems. It removes AWS Lambda-specific functionality, request handling, and action definition and replaces it with tool_call decorator. Several utility functions are added for handling tool calls and instances. The description of the package is updated in setup.py and README.md to reflect the change from an API management library to an AI interaction helper library.

Updated Vaul library version in setup.py
The version of the Vaul library is updated from "0.1.0" to "0.2.0" in setup.py.

Updated software license from GNU GPL to MIT
The software license has been changed from GNU General Public License to MIT License in the LICENSE.txt file. The MIT license is concise and straightforward, allowing for more flexibility and less complexity in terms of the permissions and conditions.

Update license and description in README
Changed the project license from the GNU General Public License v3.0 to the MIT License in the README file. Also, added some specificity and clarity in the description of the project's relationship with the 'Instructor' package.

Add 'More Complex Examples' section to README.md
Inserted a 'More Complex Examples' section to the README.md file. This section provides readers with in-depth examples of possible complex applications, aiding with a comprehensive understanding of the codebase. Other minor documentation changes and improvements were also made.

Remove Jira issue transition and comment methods from README.md
The commit removed the Jira issue transitions and comments related methods from README.md. Also, references to these methods were deleted from the 'tools' section. Furthermore, removed some unnecessary configuration parameters and added a roadmap for future features and improvements.

Update library version and refine utility functions
Updated the version of the Vaul Python library from 0.2.0 to 0.2.1. The update also includes refinement to the utility functions, with removal of the check for empty input dictionaries and the simplification of the key removal logic in 'utils.py'. Additionally, made changes in 'decorators.py' to allow empty arguments in the required field.
